output.analysis:
Let's analyze this post according to our criteria:
1. Has CMF: Yes - "CMF 11240017" is present at the end of the post 2. Refers to candidate: Yes - Mentions "Răzvan Popa" specifically as Senate candidate 3. Addresses wide population: Yes - It's a paid advertisement on Facebook/Instagram with significant reach (80,000-90,000 impressions) 4. Electoral objective: Yes - Direct call to action "Votează PSD" and "Votează Răzvan Popa Senator!" 5. Journalism: No - This is clearly campaign material, not journalistic content 6. Personal opinion: No - This is an official party communication with CMF number
This appears to be a parliamentary election advertisement, which is currently allowed as the parliamentary election campaign period is ongoing. The post is specifically promoting: - PSD as a party - Răzvan Popa as a Senate candidate
This does NOT appear to be related to the presidential election, which would be prohibited at this time.

conclusion.electoral-propaganda-analysis: This is clearly electoral propaganda, but it's LEGAL propaganda because: - It targets parliamentary elections (allowed) - Has proper CMF number - Clear party affiliation - Direct candidate promotion - Does not mention or influence presidential election
